alert.note: Alert for Southeast Aroostook (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 22 at 10:56AM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Washington, southeastern Aroostook and east central Penobscot Counties through NOON EDT... At 1055 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking multiple strong thunderstorms near Reed Plantation, or 11 miles northwest of Danforth, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Houlton, Danforth, Hodgdon, Amity, Haynesville, Cary Plantation, Wytopitlock, Reed Plantation, Linneus, Mattawamkeag, Chester, Winn, Woodville, Weston, Cary, Prentiss, Kingman, Reed, Orient and Macwahoc. This includes US Highway 1 between Danforth and Hodgdon. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
